channel.title: The Solari Report Digest
channel.description: Learn what's really happening in the global financial system to help you navigate the rapidly changing political and economic landscape.
channel.itunes:author: Catherine Austin Fitts
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn what's really happening in the global financial system to help you navigate the rapidly changing political and economic landscape.
channel.itunes:summary: The Solari Report Digest showcases excerpts from The Solari Report. In The Solari Report weekly briefing, Catherine Austin Fitts brings her unique perspective on what's really happening with world issues affecting your assets and your life.

item.title: SRD #24 - A Time for Transparency Col. Lawrence Wilkersons take on war and our energy future. Hot money vs. Cold Feet. Franklin Sanders discusses swings in the precious metals market. The Art of Economic Warfare. Jim Norman on oil prices and China.

item.title: SRD #3 - A Tale of Two Economies, A Historical perspective on the future with George Ure, and JFK, the movie, revisited
item.author: podcasts@solari.com (Catherine Austin Fitts)
item.description: A tale of two economies-Goldman Sachs' recent profits and optimistic outlook for the economy don't add up. A historical view odf the future with entrepreneur, George Ure, of UrbanSurvival.com. "Let's go to the Movies" - Oliver Stone's "JFK"
item.itunes:author: Catherine Austin Fitts
item.itunes:subtitle: • Highlights from the Solari Report Briefings this month include a look at Goldman Sachs and why their recent profits and predictably optimistic outlook for the economy may not apply to the rest of us. It’s a tale of two economies. • Also, Cathe...
item.itunes:summary: • Highlights from the Solari Report Briefings this month include a look at Goldman Sachs and why their recent profits and predictably optimistic outlook for the economy may not apply to the rest of us. It’s a tale of two economies. • Also, Catherine and entrepreneur George Ure, proprietor of the Urban Survival and Peoplenomics websites, shed some light on covert government operations and black budgets that have been operating since the 1800s. It’s a business model gone wild! • And we take another look back at history with a highlight from one of our favorite features on the Solari Report called “Let’s Go to the Movies”. Here Catherine reflects on “JFK”, Oliver Stone’s classic and relevant film exploring the investigation into the assassination of President John F. Kennedy led by then New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison. Visit http://solari.com/podcast

item.title: SRD #2 - The Financial coup d'etat, the New World debutante party, and outsourced and out of money
item.author: podcasts@solari.com (Catherine Austin Fitts)
item.description: The financial coup d'etat; the New World Order debutante party, or dancing with disaster. And outsourced and out of money, two examples of the high cost of doing things on the cheap.
item.itunes:author: Catherine Austin Fitts
item.itunes:subtitle: • Is the financial coup d’etat heating up? Or, is the “slow burn” speeding up? As the impacts of a centrally managed economy become apparent, we’ve got some practical tips on what you can do to stay focused on the opportunities in your perso...
item.itunes:summary: • Is the financial coup d’etat heating up? Or, is the “slow burn” speeding up? As the impacts of a centrally managed economy become apparent, we’ve got some practical tips on what you can do to stay focused on the opportunities in your personal and financial life. • The new world order debutante party – Dancing with disaster with the Vatican, the G8 nations, and the World Trade Organization. • Outsourced and out of money? Two examples of the high cost of doing things on the cheap at the state and local level.

item.title: SRD #1 - Franklin Sanders, Community Derivatives, Terrorism and the Economy
item.author: podcasts@solari.com (Catherine Austin Fitts)
item.description: Catherine Austin Fitts and precious metals expert Franklin Sanders discuss precious metals ETF's - is the gold and silver really in inventory? Thinking outside the bank - Community Derivatives. Connecting the dots between terrorism and the economy.
item.itunes:author: Catherine Austin Fitts
item.itunes:subtitle: In our first Solari Report Digest, Catherine gives an example of how local communities and individuals can use the same contracts and techniques as the big banks to create more financial security and liquidity for themselves through what she call...
item.itunes:summary:
In our first Solari Report Digest, Catherine gives an example of how local communities and individuals can use the same contracts and techniques as the big banks to create more financial security and liquidity for themselves through what she calls "Community Derivatives".
Next, from the Solari Report Money and Markets segment, Catherine sheds light on one of the darker aspects of the US financial system as it currently exists, and the hard truth of our complicity as unwitting or acquiescent accomplices to torture in a wartime economy.
In closing, Catherine and precious metals expert Franklin Sanders look at "exchange traded funds", also known as ETFs, and ask, "Is the gold and silver really in inventory?".
